reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening HMIS, Laboratory System and Procurement & Supply Chain Management Systems and enhancing State Engagement in Nigeria

description.narrative: Nigeria - RSSH - National Agency for the Control of AIDS - NACA. This program has the following goals: RSSH: Strengthen the procurement and supply chain management system for efficient health service delivery. RSSH: Strengthen the National Health Management Informaton System (NHMIS). RSSH: Ensure equitable, safe, appropriate, quality, and effective laboratory services to meet current and future needs. RSSH: Promote community engagement for sustainable health development. RSSH: Ensure equitable, safe, appropriate, quality, and effective medical and laboratory services to meet current and future needs. RSSH: Provide effective leadership and an enabling policy environment that ensures adequate oversight and accountability for the delivery of quality health care for sustainable development of the national health system. The objectives of this program are: RSSH: Strengthen the availability and use of affordable, accessible and quality medicines, vaccines, and other health commodities and technologies at all levels. RSSH: Improve the health status of Nigerians through the provision of timely, appropriate and reliable health information services at all levels, for evidence-based decision-making. RSSH: Provide appropriate, efficient, quality, equitable and cost-effective public health and medical laboratory services at all levels of health care delivery. RSSH: Strengthen community-level coordination mechanisms and capacities for health planning. RSSH: Strengthen the provision of health services at public and private health facilities that are appropriate, accessible and meet minimum quality and safety standard for optimized health outcomes

title.narrative: Percentage of National Reference Laboratories accredited according to ISO15189 standard or achieving at least 4 stars towards accreditation
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Percentage of health facilities providing diagnostic services with tracer items available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Percentage of districts that produce periodic analytical report(s) as per nationally agreed plan and reporting format during the reporting period
Percentage of facilities which record and submit data using the electronic information system
